Util Namespace Reference

The Util namespace contains definitions to port the library onto an operating system. More...

class  ByteAllocator
 ByteAllocator of fixed size objects with cache for fast allocation (thread unsafe)A list registers freed blocks until a given theshold. Allocation tries to found a block in the list before using standard allocation. Deallocation puts a block in the list until list size is equal to threshold. At that time normal deallocation is done. We can define a new allocator of cells: More...

class  Object
 Object with synchronisation mutex and condition variablesThe Object class defines object that needs to have and identifier, reference counter and synchronisation primitives. Only the identifier and reference counter are part of the state of the object. The synchronisation objects (one mutex and one condition) should not considered as in the state of the object. Thus all methods involving only synchronisation objects may be declared as 'const' with respect to the object. More...

class  CriticalGuard
 Transparent mutual exclusion facility.This class implements a transparent local scoping usage of mutex lock. An instance of this class is used to lock a bloc expression using the lexical scope of variable definition in C++. At the initialization of such an object, the associated mutex is locked and is unlocked at the destruction of the object (at the end of its scope as a C++ variable). Note that the unlock method is alway called even if an exception is thrown. Please read the code example associated with the Mutex class before reading this code. More...
class  RWCriticalGuard
 Transparent mutual exclusion facility.This class implements a transparent local scoping usage of RW lock. An instance of this class is used to read-lock a bloc expression using the lexical scope of variable definition in C++. At the initialization of such an object, the associated rwlock is read-locked and is unlocked at the destruction of the object (at the end of its scope as a C++ variable). Note that the unlock method is alway called even if an exception is thrown. Please read the code example associated with the RWLock class before reading this code. More...
class  Key
 Thread private attributeThis class provides an interface to posix pthread specific attributes. It only includes operators for :

  • getting specific data key create() with a value destructor function called at the end of the thread
  • setting/getting specific data set() get().

class  CounterManager
 Management of counters to collect in order to produce statisticsEach process generates an Counters data that correspond to a set of counters (user defined, applications defined...). These Counters are cumulated in order to produce global statistics about the execution. This operation involves an field by field accumulation with various cumulative operators (+, max, min ). A set of userdefined field exist. That could be re-used in order to cumulate order counter. More...

class  LongDouble
class  GlobalId
 Class for representing a global identifier of the distributed processusGlobal Identifier values are segmented in order to reserve special name for some special meaning. The unsigned integer on 32 bits are organized as following: b31|b30|...|b1|b0 where bi is the i-th bit. b31 is the high order bit. Bits b31|b30, if non nul represent special values.

  • b31|b30 = 0|0: user defined values between 0 and 2^30-1 (1073741823 values)
  • b31|b30|b29= 1|1|1: special values
    • ALL_SITE: all other bits are =1
    • NO_SITE: all other bits are =0
  • b31|b30|b29= 1|1|0: for identifying checkpoint servers
  • b31|b30|b29= 1|0|0: for identifying temporary name using counter
  • b31|b30|b29= 1|0|1: for identifying temporary name using hash value.
More...

Pointer

Type for a global pointer

Util::Pointer is the type to represent a generic pointer into one of the address space of a set of process on differents architecture. The size in bits of the Util::Pointer is at least enough to represent any of the LocalPointer of the architecture. The current implementation is to represent any pointer as a 64 bits long integer. Thus a remote pointer is close to an 64 bits integer.

Author:
T. Gautier

Detailed Description

The Util namespace contains definitions to port the library onto an operating system.

specialization for string

size of string size A string is recorded as its size followed by its bytes

typedef ka_uint8_t Util::TraceEventNo

types for numbering events

typedef ka_uint8_t Util::TraceLevelNo

types for numbering levels

Event file format The event record in a file as the following predefined fields:

  • level (uint8_t): level identifier of the event
  • event code (uint8_t): code identifier of the event
  • event size (uint16_t): the size (Bytes) of the record including these fields
  • date (double):
  • [optional data that depend of the event number]

Events are generated by threads (context id) on processor on process. Each threads maintains its own event buffer where generated events are stored. The event file is a sequence of event buffers from each threads, each events buffers has the following header:

  • global id (uint32_t): the process identifier or global identifier
  • context id (uint32_t): the context id from which event has been generated

Threads may switch between processor during the execution. This information is given by events defined in kaapi_events at the level of TR_KERNEL_LEVEL.
